intro: Hemidesmus pubescens, commonly known as Indian Snakeroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine.
